title: Disable Fast Forward Merging
description: Git is a powerful version control system that allows developers to collaborate on projects efficiently. One of the features of Git is fast forward merging, which allows Git to automatically merge branches that have no divergent commits. However, this feature can sometimes cause issues, especially when working on larger projects with multiple contributors. In this challenge, you will learn how to disable fast forward merging by default.

meta.title: Disable Fast Forward Merging: Mastering Git's Powerful Versioning
meta.description: Discover how to disable fast forward merging in Git, a crucial technique for managing complex projects with multiple contributors.
